alert.note: Alert for Greater Vancouver Area; Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County; South Washington Cascade Foothills; South Washington Coast; Willapa Hills (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Frost Advisory issued May 08 at 7:57PM PDT until May 09 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FROST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 8 AM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Patchy frost. Cool with partial clearing overnight, allowing tempeatures dropping into the lower to middle 30s. * WHERE...Northwest Oregon and southwest Washington, from the coast to the Cascades foothills. This includes the interior lowlands. Highest danger of frost will be in the lowlands along the coast, as well as valleys of the Willapa Hills and northwest Oregon Coast Range, and the Cowlitz River Valley. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 8 AM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Frost could kill sensitive outdoor vegetation if left uncovered. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Frost will be patchy in nature, as big question is the amount of clearing expected. At moment, skies will not clear completely, keeping most areas in the middle to upper 30s overnight. As such, frost will be patchy in nature.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.

area.areaDesc: Greater Vancouver Area; Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County; South Washington Cascade Foothills; South Washington Coast; Willapa Hills
